othello

Class AIHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • othello.AIHelper

  • public class AIHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    StudentRelevant

    This is a class containing static helper methods that AIPlayers can (and should) use to help ensure they're following the rules/mechanics of the Othello board game, in particular what valid moves are available for a given board state (getValidMoves(int[][], int, int)) and the board state the results from making a specific move (tryMove(int[][], Location, int, int)).

    This class acts as an interface to the "real" game logic methods in OthelloLogic by converting the student representation of a board (int[][]) into temporary instances of Board classes.

    • Method Detail

      • getValidMoves

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Location> getValidMoves(int[][] boardArray,
                                                          int playerID,
                                                          int opponentID)
        StudentRelevant

        Computes the valid moves from a given board state

        Parameters:
        boardArray - a 2D int array representing the current board state (with 0s for unoccupied tiles, and occupied tiles containing their owner's playerID)
        playerID - the ID of the current player (the one who is about to make a move). Usually obtained from Player.getID()
        opponentID - the ID of the opponent player. Usually obtained from Player.getOpponentID()
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Location objects representing the valid moves (empty list if none available)

      • tryMove

        public static int[][] tryMove(int[][] boardArray,
                              Location loc,
                              int playerID,
                              int opponentID)
        StudentRelevant

        Performs the provided move (and resulting captures/flips) and returns a new copy of the resulting board.

        Precondition: the move Location should be a valid move (e.g. a move returned from a call to getValidMoves(int[][], int, int) with the same board state)

        Parameters:
        boardArray - a 2D int array representing the current board state. This array does not get updated.
        loc - the Location to place a tile, i.e. the move
        playerID - the ID of the current player (the one who is placing the tile). Usually obtained from Player.getID()
        opponentID - the ID of the opponent player. Usually obtained from Player.getOpponentID()
        Returns:
        a new copy of the board, with the newly placed tile and all of opponent's captured pieces flipped

      • copyOfBoard

        public static int[][] copyOfBoard(Board board)
        Converts/copies a Board into a simpler 2D array of integers representing player IDs on the board (0s for empty squares)
        Parameters:
        board - the current board state
        Returns:
        the int[][] equivalent of the provided Board

        Returns:
        the int[][] equivalent of the provided Board
